pageContext.claim: “We've added nearly 400,000 new manufacturing jobs, remember? You'll never have another manufacturing job, right? He's the guy. You'll never have another manufacturing job, remember the magic wand? What are you going to get, a magic wand? Yes, I got a magic wand. And very soon, it's going to be 600,000.”
pageContext.analysis: U.S. manufacturing employment has been increasing at a steady rate since 2010.  The Bureau of Labor Statistics in August revised the figure downward, to 348,000 jobs since he became president, indicating the president’s tariff war was taking a toll on manufacturing.
